Introduction

Moonbin (1998–2023) was a South Korean singer, dancer, and actor, best known as a member of the boy group ASTRO and its first sub-unit, Moonbin & Sanha. He debuted with ASTRO on February 23, 2016, through their extended play Spring Up, where he contributed as the main vocalist and lead dancer. His career spanned both music and acting, with his most notable acting role being in the drama Moments of Eighteen (2019), where he played the character Jung Oh-je.

In 2020, Moonbin expanded his career by forming the sub-unit Moonbin & Sanha with his bandmate Sanha. Their debut EP, In-Out, was released on September 14, 2020, with the lead single "Bad Idea." The duo quickly gained popularity, earning their first music show win within days of their debut. In addition to his music career, Moonbin showcased his versatility by participating in various variety shows, including hosting Show Champion and starring in the web drama The Mermaid Prince.

Tragically, Moonbin passed away on April 19, 2023, at the age of 25. He was found at his home in Seoul, and authorities later confirmed the possibility of his death by suicide. His passing was met with an outpouring of grief from fans and the entertainment community, and he was laid to rest in a private funeral as per his family's wishes.
